DataElement.preferredName: Liver Cancer American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 Clinical Tumor T Stage
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the primary hepatocellular carcinoma based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined prior to treatment.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to clinical evaluated T stage of a large organ located in the upper abdomen that cleanses the blood and aids in digestion by secreting bile (the liver).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A large organ located in the upper abdomen. The liver cleanses the blood and aids in digestion by secreting bile.:(NEE-o-PLAY-zha) Abnormal and uncontrolled cell growth.

Concepts.definition: A triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium. It is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg. Metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions. It is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the examination and treatment of patients.:One criteria of the TMN staging system.  T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

Concepts.definition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 12/19/18 TT received CTEP permission/BC to transfer DEC ownership to NCI Standards.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Liver Cancer American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 T Stage
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A finding about one or more characteristics of liver cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system.  Intrahepatic bile duct cancers are no longer included in this classification.  The staging of liver cancer now includes only hepatocellular carcinoma. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)_A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._One criteria of the TMN staging system.  T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion)._The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Liver Cancer pT4 TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Liver Cancer pT4 TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Liver cancer with tumor(s) with direct invasion of adjacent organs other than the gallbladder or with perforation of visceral peritoneum. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Liver Cancer pT4 TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Liver cancer with tumor(s) with direct invasion of adjacent organs other than the gallbladder or with perforation of visceral peritoneum. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Liver Cancer pT3b TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Liver Cancer pT3b TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Liver cancer with single tumor or multiple tumors of any size involving a major branch of the portal vein or hepatic vein. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Liver Cancer pT3b TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Liver cancer with single tumor or multiple tumors of any size involving a major branch of the portal vein or hepatic vein. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Liver Cancer pT3a TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Liver Cancer pT3a TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Liver cancer with multiple tumors more than 5 cm in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Liver Cancer pT3a TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Liver cancer with multiple tumors more than 5 cm in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Liver Cancer pT2 TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Liver Cancer pT2 TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Liver cancer with solitary tumor with vascular invasion or multiple tumors none more than 5 cm in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Liver Cancer pT2 TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Liver cancer with solitary tumor with vascular invasion or multiple tumors none more than 5 cm in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Liver Cancer pT1 TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Liver Cancer pT1 TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Liver cancer with solitary tumor without vascular invasion. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Liver Cancer pT1 TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Liver cancer with solitary tumor without vascular invasion. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Liver Cancer pT0 TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Liver Cancer pT0 TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Liver cancer with no evidence of a primary tumor. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Liver Cancer pT0 TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Liver cancer with no evidence of a primary tumor. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Liver Cancer pTX TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Liver Cancer pTX TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Liver cancer in which the primary tumor cannot be assessed. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Liver Cancer pTX TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Liver cancer in which the primary tumor cannot be assessed. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A finding about one or more characteristics of liver cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system.  Intrahepatic bile duct cancers are no longer included in this classification.  The staging of liver cancer now includes only hepatocellular carcinoma. (from AJCC 7th Ed.):A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications.:One criteria of the TMN staging system.  T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).:The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

Concepts.definition: A finding about one or more characteristics of liver cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system.  Intrahepatic bile duct cancers are no longer included in this classification.  The staging of liver cancer now includes only hepatocellular carcinoma. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)
A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).
The extent of a cancer in the body.
